text: ਆਸਨੁ ਪਵਨ ਦੂਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਵਰੇ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Abandon your Yogic postures and breath control exercises, O madman.

transliteration.text: āsan pavan dūr kar bavarē .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਛੋਡਿ ਕਪਟੁ ਨਿਤ ਹਰਿ ਭਜੁ ਬਵਰੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Renounce fraud and deception, and meditate continuously on the Lord, O madman. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: shōd kapat nit har bhaj bavarē .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜਿਹ ਤੂ ਜਾਚਹਿ ਸੋ ਤ੍ਰਿਭਵਨ ਭੋਗੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: That which you beg for, has been enjoyed in the three worlds.

transliteration.text: jih tū jāchah sō tribhavan bhōgī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਕੇਸੌ ਜਗਿ ਜੋਗੀ ॥੨॥੮॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, the Lord is the only Yogi in the world. ||2||8||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr kēsau jag jōgī .2.8.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਬਿਲਾਵਲੁ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bilaaval:

transliteration.text: bilāval .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਇਨ੍ਹਿ ਮਾਇਆ ਜਗਦੀਸ ਗੁਸਾਈ ਤੁਮ੍ਹਰੇ ਚਰਨ ਬਿਸਾਰੇ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This Maya has made me forget Your feet, O Lord of the World, Master of the Universe.

transliteration.text: inh māiā jagadīs gusāī tumharē charan bisārē .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਕਿੰਚਤ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਨ ਉਪਜੈ ਜਨ ਕਉ ਜਨ ਕਹਾ ਕਰਹਿ ਬੇਚਾਰੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Not even a bit of love wells up in Your humble servant; what can Your poor servant do? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kinchat prīt n upajai jan kau jan kahā karah bēchārē .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਤਨੁ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਧਨੁ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਇਹ ਮਾਇਆ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਧ੍ਰਿਗੁ ਮਤਿ ਬੁਧਿ ਫੰਨੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Cursed is the body, cursed is the wealth, and cursed is this Maya; cursed, cursed is the clever intellect and understanding.

transliteration.text: dhrig tan dhrig dhan dhrig ih māiā dhrig dhrig mat budh phannī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਇਸ ਮਾਇਆ ਕਉ ਦ੍ਰਿੜੁ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਖਹੁ ਬਾਂਧੇ ਆਪ ਬਚੰਨੀ ॥੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Restrain and hold back this Maya; overcome it, through the Word of the Guru's Teachings. ||1||

transliteration.text: is māiā kau drir kar rākhah bānhdhē āp bachannī .1.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਕਿਆ ਖੇਤੀ ਕਿਆ ਲੇਵਾ ਦੇਈ ਪਰਪੰਚ ਝੂਠੁ ਗੁਮਾਨਾ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: What good is farming, and what good is trading? Worldly entanglements and pride are false.

transliteration.text: kiā khētī kiā lēvā dēī parapanch jhūth gumānā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਤੇ ਅੰਤਿ ਬਿਗੂਤੇ ਆਇਆ ਕਾਲੁ ਨਿਦਾਨਾ ॥੨॥੯॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, in the end, they are ruined; ultimately, Death will come for them. ||2||9||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr tē ant bigūtē āiā kāl nidānā .2.9.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. translation.text: Bilaaval:

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਸਰੀਰ ਸਰੋਵਰ ਭੀਤਰੇ ਆਛੈ ਕਮਲ ਅਨੂਪ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Within the pool of the body, there is an incomparably beautiful lotus flower.

transliteration.text: sarīr sarōvar bhītarē āshai kamal anūp .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਪਰਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਪੁਰਖੋਤਮੋ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਰੇਖ ਨ ਰੂਪ ॥੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Within it, is the Supreme Light, the Supreme Soul, who has no feature or form. ||1||

transliteration.text: param jōt purakhōtamō jā kai rēkh n rūp .1.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਰੇ ਮਨ ਹਰਿ ਭਜੁ ਭ੍ਰਮੁ ਤਜਹੁ ਜਗਜੀਵਨ ਰਾਮ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O my mind, vibrate, meditate on the Lord, and forsake your doubt. The Lord is the Life of the World. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: rē man har bhaj bhram tajah jagajīvan rām .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਆਵਤ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਦੀਸਈ ਨਹ ਦੀਸੈ ਜਾਤ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Nothing is seen coming into the world, and nothing is seen leaving it.

transliteration.text: āvat kashū n dīsaī nah dīsai jāt .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਜਹ ਉਪਜੈ ਬਿਨਸੈ ਤਹੀ ਜੈਸੇ ਪੁਰਿਵਨ ਪਾਤ ॥੨॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Where the body is born, there it dies, like the leaves of the water-lily. ||2||

transliteration.text: jah upajai binasai tahī jaisē purivan pāt .2.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

text: ਮਿਥਿਆ ਕਰਿ ਮਾਇਆ ਤਜੀ ਸੁਖ ਸਹਜ ਬੀਚਾਰਿ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Maya is false and transitory; forsaking it, one obtains peaceful, celestial contemplation.

transliteration.text: mithiā kar māiā tajī sukh sahaj bīchār .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.description:

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਕਰਹੁ ਮਨ ਮੰਝਿ ਮੁਰਾਰਿ ॥੩॥੧੦॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, serve Him within your mind; He is the Enemy of ego, the Destroyer of demons. ||3||10||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr sēvā karah man manjh murār .3.10.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਕਾ ਭ੍ਰਮੁ ਗਇਆ ਗੋਬਿਦ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਗੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The illusion of birth and death is gone; I lovingly focus on the Lord of the Universe.

transliteration.text: janam maran kā bhram gaiā gōbid liv lāgī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਜੀਵਤ ਸੁੰਨਿ ਸਮਾਨਿਆ ਗੁਰ ਸਾਖੀ ਜਾਗੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In my life, I am absorbed in deep silent meditation; the Guru's Teachings have awakened me. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jīvat sunn samāniā gur sākhī jāgī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਕਾਸੀ ਤੇ ਧੁਨਿ ਊਪਜੈ ਧੁਨਿ ਕਾਸੀ ਜਾਈ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The sound made from bronze, that sound goes into the bronze again.

transliteration.text: kāsī tē dhun ūpajai dhun kāsī jāī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

text: ਕਾਸੀ ਫੂਟੀ ਪੰਡਿਤਾ ਧੁਨਿ ਕਹਾਂ ਸਮਾਈ ॥੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But when the bronze is broken, O Pandit, O religious scholar, where does the sound go then? ||1||

transliteration.text: kāsī phūtī panditā dhun kahānh samāī .1.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਤ੍ਰਿਕੁਟੀ ਸੰਧਿ ਮੈ ਪੇਖਿਆ ਘਟ ਹੂ ਘਟ ਜਾਗੀ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I gaze upon the world, the confluence of the three qualities; God is awake and aware in each and every heart.

transliteration.text: trikutī sandh mai pēkhiā ghat hū ghat jāgī .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਐਸੀ ਬੁਧਿ ਸਮਾਚਰੀ ਘਟ ਮਾਹਿ ਤਿਆਗੀ ॥੨॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such is the understanding revealed to me; within my heart, I have become a detached renunciate. ||2||

transliteration.text: aisī budh samācharī ghat māh tiāgī .2.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਆਪੁ ਆਪ ਤੇ ਜਾਨਿਆ ਤੇਜ ਤੇਜੁ ਸਮਾਨਾ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have come to know my own self, and my light has merged in the Light.

transliteration.text: āp āp tē jāniā tēj tēj samānā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਅਬ ਜਾਨਿਆ ਗੋਬਿਦ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨਾ ॥੩॥੧੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, now I know the Lord of the Universe, and my mind is satisfied. ||3||11||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr ab jāniā gōbid man mānā .3.11.

text: ਬਿਲਾਵਲੁ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bilaaval:

transliteration.text: bilāval .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None

text: ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਜਾ ਕੈ ਰਿਦੈ ਬਸਹਿ ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਕਿਉ ਡੋਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When Your Lotus Feet dwell within one's heart, why should that person waver, O Divine Lord?

transliteration.text: charan kamal jā kai ridai basah sō jan kiu dōlai dēv .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. text: ਮਾਨੌ ਸਭ ਸੁਖ ਨਉ ਨਿਧਿ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਜਸੁ ਬੋਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I know that all comforts, and the nine treasures, come to one who intuitively, naturally, chants the Praise of the Divine Lord. ||Pause||

transliteration.text: mānau sabh sukh nau nidh tā kai sahaj sahaj jas bōlai dēv . rahāu .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. text: ਤਬ ਇਹ ਮਤਿ ਜਉ ਸਭ ਮਹਿ ਪੇਖੈ ਕੁਟਿਲ ਗਾਂਠਿ ਜਬ ਖੋਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such wisdom comes, only when one sees the Lord in all, and unties the knot of hypocrisy.

transliteration.text: tab ih mat jau sabh mah pēkhai kutil gānhth jab khōlai dēv .

text: ਬਾਰੰ ਬਾਰ ਮਾਇਆ ਤੇ ਅਟਕੈ ਲੈ ਨਰਜਾ ਮਨੁ ਤੋਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥੧॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Time and time again, he must hold himself back from Maya; let him take the scale of the Lord, and weigh his mind. ||1||

transliteration.text: bāran bār māiā tē atakai lai narajā man tōlai dēv .1.

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. text: ਜਹ ਉਹੁ ਜਾਇ ਤਹੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਵੈ ਮਾਇਆ ਤਾਸੁ ਨ ਝੋਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Then wherever he goes, he will find peace, and Maya will not shake him.

transliteration.text: jah uh jāi tahī sukh pāvai māiā tās n jhōlai dēv .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਮੇਰਾ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨਿਆ ਰਾਮ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਕੀਓ ਲੈ ਦੇਵ ॥੨॥੧੨॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, my mind believes in the Lord; I am absorbed in the Love of the Divine Lord. ||2||12||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr mērā man māniā rām prīt kīō lai dēv .2.12.

text: ਬਿਲਾਵਲੁ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਕੀ
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bilaaval, The Word Of Devotee Naam Dayv Jee:

transliteration.text: bilāval bānī bhagat nāmadēv jī kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਸਫਲ ਜਨਮੁ ਮੋ ਕਉ ਗੁਰ ਕੀਨਾ ॥
section: Bilaval - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Guru has made my life fruitful.

transliteration.text: saphal janam mō kau gur kīnā .

melody.description: Bilaval conveys the emotions of great happiness that come from having attained a goal or achieved an aim. It is an overwhelming feeling of fulfilment, satisfaction and joy, that is experienced when the accomplishments is very important and dear to you. The happiness felt is like laughing out loud, there is no planning or any ulterior motive; it’s just a natural expression of heartfelt happiness arising from a sense of achievement.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.
